result.execSummary:
The defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).
  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Agents prior approval is requried for residence location.  Agents prior approval is required for any out of home stay that exceeds 2 nights.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling/treatment or combination of the three.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herbert C. Grosenheider Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits 1 - 4 attached

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Jennifer Amelia Cunha.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to $6,649.25 in restitution to Calvin and Shirley Maurer.  Atty Cunha advises DE does not agree to amounts owed to Harley and Judy Rogers.  State calls Harley E. Rogers - S&T.  State offers Exhibits 1-4.  Court receives exhibits.  Atty Cunha cross-exams.  Atty Calkins re-directs.  Atty Cunha re-crosses.  State calls Dawn Rogers - S&T.  Atty Cunha cross-exams.  Atty Cunha calls Cora Hatfield - S&T.  Atty Calkins cross-exams.  State requests $6,544.63 be paid in restitution to the Roger's family.  Atty Cunah requests the court not order restitution to the Roger's family due to lack of information.  Court orders that the electric piano, any gold coin collection and jewelry of Diane be turned over to Cora Hatfield.  Atty Cunha calls Herbert Grosenheider - S&T.  Atty Calkins cross-exams.  Atty Calkins re-calls Cora Hatfield.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $2,350.75 to be paid to Harley and Judy Rogers.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $6,649.25 to be paid to Calvin and Shirley Maurer.  Court orders DOC to hold up to 25% of DE's prison account for purposes of payment of restitution.  The Maurer family shall be compensated first for restitution payments and then to the Roger's family.
Restitution hearing on March 29, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Jen Cunha.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises witness is hospitalized.  Matter reset.  DE to maintain in Sauk County until Wednesday of this week as matter has not been concluded.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 29, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins and intern Cody M. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes PSI, addendum to PSI and sentencing memorandum.  S.M. makes statement.  B.M. makes statement.  J.B. makes statement.  J.K. makes statement.  C.H. makes statement.  E.H. makes statement.  B.S. makes statement.  Atty. Calkins makes sentencing recommendation 16 years (6 yrs IC and 10 yrs ES) on both counts.  $518 on each; AODA/treatment; Provide DNA Sample and surcharge; Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.  Pay restitution and request hearing within 30 days.  Atty. Raabe makes recommendation 3 yrs. IC and extensive supervision.  Defendant makes statement.   Court makes sentencing remarks.   Court imposes sentence.

Count 1: 
WI State Prison for 12 years (4 yrs IC/8 yrs ES)  Consecutive

Count 2:
WI State Prision 11 years (3 yrs IC/8 yrs ES) Concurrent to Ct. 1
359 days credit 
Conditions on both counts:

Submit to DNA Sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
Agent's priorapproval is required for residence location
Agent's prior approval is required for any out of home stay that exceeds 2 nights
No possession or consumption of any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia w/o a valid Rx - if prescription, must be provided to agent w/in 48 hours.
Full time employment/schooling/treatment or any combo of the 3
$ Restitution w/ 15% Surcharge To: set forth on the proposed stipulation - 1st Maurer, 2nd split b/w the other two victims; May request hearing within 30 days
$518.00 x 2 Costs & Supervision Fees
$250 DNA Surcharge
Not Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program 
Not Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
Paperwork handed in court.

Supplemental Facts to Support the Amended Information

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Raabe states DE will enter pleas today.  Stipulation filed re: supplemental facts.  State files amended information in 15CF254 and then states recs.  Atty Raabe is in agreement, acknowledges rec. amended information in 15CF254, waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Raabe enters Guilty pleas in both counts of amended information.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court dismisses but reads in 15CF15 and 14CF299.  Court orders PSI not later than 4/29/2016 w/sentencing to be set some time after that date.  Bond continued pending sentencing.

Ct 2:  Guilty

Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in court with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Drew Bulin appears.  Atty. Calkins calls officer Drew Bulin, SCSD, S&T.  Atty. Benevides objects to foundation, overruled.  Atty. Benevides cross exam witness.  Atty. Calkins objects, relevance, overruled. State rests.  State moves Court for probable cause and bind over.  Atty. Benevides gives brief argument.  Court does find probable cause, bind over. Defendant Herbert C. Grosenheider appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Address is correct and defendant does qualify.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $200,000 cash bond with conditions.  Attorney ORourke request signature bond.  No warrants for failure to appear.  Time limits waived. $25,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of restricted or controlled substances unless valid Rx.  May not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
